author: GamingBolt
description:
The year has finally run its course, thankfully, because the sooner we can get to Resident Evil Requiem, Grand Theft Auto 6, and Reanimal, the better. But before we send off 2025 with a hearty farewell and good riddance, there are 15 brand new titles to look forward to in December. 

You know the drill - sequels, long development cycles, and my personal favorite, a good ol' beat 'em up. Let's dive right into them, starting with...
title: 14 Big New Games of December 2025 You Can’t Ignore

author: GamingBolt
description:
It's an interesting time we live in, one in which the controllers we use have become as important as the consoles we play our games on. That's thanks in no small part to Sony and the DualSense controller it introduced alongside the PS5. 

With a feature set that sets it apart from its competition, this versatile device has allowed many talented developers to add flourishes to their games that were otherwise out of reach. 

We've come to look out for such titles, and put together a few of them for you to check out. Just be ready to charge up your controllers more often, as these ones are going to do a number on its battery. The additions they bring to each of these titles are worth it, though.

Link to Part 1: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=D0eWVbKIhqY
title: 15 PS5 Games That Prove DualSense Is Still Untouchable

author: GamingBolt
description:
Total Chaos brings a lot to like to its take on the survival horror genre. As an unnamed member of the Coast Guard stranded on Fort Oasis after a storm, making your way through the mysterious island is going to have you white knuckled and anticipating a vicious attack from all directions thanks to its well designed levels and nasty enemies. 

It's an experience that works, and works well thanks to intelligent decisions that make it click right from the get go. But is it good enough to rub shoulders with the best of 2025's best? Join us as we take a look at what clicks for this one, what doesn't, and help you decide if it's going to be worth your time and money.
title: Total Chaos Review - Brutal Survival Horror With Rough Edges
